snippet: As many as 500 officers — roughly 5 percent of the Los Angeles Police Department — spent the last week protecting one another from Christopher J. Dorner, now believed dead.
abstract: As many as 500 police officers--roughly 5 percent of Los Angeles Police Department--mobilized to protect one another from suspected police killer Christopher J Dorner, now believed dead.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA, IAN LOVETT and FERNANDA SANTOS
byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from Los Angeles; Ian Lovett from Big Bear Lake, Calif.; and Fernanda Santos from Angelus Oaks, Calif. Erica Goode contributed reporting from Washington; Rebecca Fairley Raney from Riverside, Calif.; and Kitty Bennett from Tampa, Fla.

lead_paragraph: As many as 500 officers — roughly 5 percent of the Los Angeles Police Department — spent the last week protecting one another from Christopher J. Dorner, now believed dead.

headline.main: Fugitive’s Threats Against Police Drew Enormous Response
